subject: Creativity
title: Travel and Imagination: Why New Places Spark New Ideas
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Travel and Imagination: Why New Places Spark New Ideas.

hook.text: Hemingway in Paris. Gauguin in Tahiti. Bowie in Berlin. Why do new places so reliably ignite creative breakthroughs?

buildup.text: Unfamiliar environments disrupt cognitive routines â€” your brain can't rely on autopilot and must process everything.

discovery.text: Research shows that multicultural experiences increase cognitive flexibility â€” the ability to see problems from.

twist.text: But you must engage deeply. Tourists who stay in resorts show no creativity benefit.

climax.text: Adam Galinsky's studies found that people who lived abroad (not just visited) solved creativity problems 20% more often.

punchline.text: New places don't inspire creativity. New perspectives do.

quiz.question: What does research require for travel to enhance creativity?
options: Deep cultural immersion, not just tourism
